html:
US: Klobuchar-Grassley 'Big Tech' Bill Markup Thursday
On Thursday the Senate Judiciary Committee will markup the American Innovation
and Choice Online Act, proposed by Senators Amy Klobuchar (D-MN) and Chuck
Grassley (R-IA).
* The bill targets tech companies that operate platforms with significant
  commercial reach, or 'covered platforms'. Among the criteria to define a
  'covered platform' are: 50 million monthly active users, a market
  capitalisation greater that USD$550 billion, and being a 'critical trading
  partner for the sale or provision of any product or service offered on or
  directly related to the online platform.'
* This definition only implicates a handful of tech giants: Microsoft, Google,
  Twitter, Apple, Spotify and Amazon, all of whom have disclosed they are
  lobbying against the bill.
* The goal of the bill is to stop big tech companies using their dominant
  platforms to preference their own products and services over other companies
  competing on their platforms.
* There appears to be some level of bipartisan support for the bill and
  reproaching big tech could be a potential vote-winner in an election year.
